sub_topic: Prove that the symmetric difference of two sets is not associative with respect to Cartesian product.
message_1: Let A = {1, 2} , B = {2, 3} and C = {1, 3}. Find (A Δ B) Δ C and A Δ (B Δ C) using the Cartesian product {(1,1), (1,2), (1,3), (2,1), (2,2), (2,3), (3,1), (3,2), (3,3)} and prove that the symmetric difference of two sets is not associative.
